intro: Pimelandra erecta, commonly known as the flame violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees and other structures in its natural habitat. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are tubular with a distinctive spurred shape. Pimelandra erecta thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil for optimal growth.
